notes.text: This CSAF advisory was extracted from unstructured data and may contain inaccuracies. If you notice any errors, please reach out to the designated contact at CISA CSAF: central@cisa.dhs.gov

notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: ATTENTION: Remotely exploitable/low skill level to exploit.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: Commercial Facilities, Critical Manufacturing, Transportation Systems
notes.title: Critical infrastructure sectors

notes.text: NCCIC recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of these vulnerabilities. Specifically, users should: Minimize network exposure for all control system devices and/or systems, and ensure that they are not accessible from the Internet; Locate control system networks and remote devices behind firewalls, and isolate them from the business network; When remote access is required, use secure methods, such as Virtual Private Networks (VPNs), recognizing that VPNs may have vulnerabilities and should be updated to the most current version available. Also recognize that VPN is only as secure as the connected devices.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: NCCIC reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: NCCIC also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS-CERT web page. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available in the NCCIC Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies, that is available for download from the ICS-CERT web site.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to NCCIC for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: No known public exploits specifically target these vulnerabilities.
notes.title: Exploitability

product.name: OnCell G3100-HSPA Series: version 1.4 Build 16062919 and prior

cwe.name: Reliance on Cookies without Validation and Integrity Checking

notes.text: The application allows a cookie parameter to consist of only digits, allowing an attacker to perform a brute force attack bypassing authentication and gaining access to device functions. CVE-2018-5455 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 9.8 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Moxa has released new firmware for OnCell G3100-HSPA that is available via the following link:

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Length Parameter Inconsistency

notes.text: An attacker may be able to edit the element of an HTTP request, causing the device to become unavailable. CVE-2018-5453 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.5 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Moxa has released new firmware for OnCell G3100-HSPA that is available via the following link:

notes.text: The application does not check for a NULL value, allowing for an attacker to perform a denial of service attack. CVE-2018-5449 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 6.5 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:A/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary
